subject: RE: [junit] Eclipse Plugin update?

messageBody:
I did a value stream map of JUnit some time back and discovered that the
main block in the flow of value was the Eclipse approval process. Yes, we
could package up the current JAR as an update site but I'm not sure how much
value that would provide to how many people. I'm willing to proven wrong.
I'm even more willing to have someone else do the work :-)

Cheers,

Kent

_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Malte Finsterwalder
Sent: Wednesday, July 22, 2009 6:57 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Eclipse Plugin update?




Hi David,

> You can install a new jar in your project's classpath, and remove the
> JUNIT_PATH element.

Yes, of course...
But the JUnit Lib in Eclipse is quite convenient.
As another workaround I can create my own user library in eclipse and use
that instead.

> However, Kent and I were talking just Monday
> night about the fact that we end up coding on the latest version of
> JUnit, but supporting, mostly, whatever last shipped with Eclipse. So
> suggestions on how to most easily enable Eclipse users to stay up to
> date are most welcome.

Wouldn't it be best, to manage the junit.jar-plugin correctly on the eclipse
update site, so that the normal eclipse update-mechanisms distribute new
junit versions.

This is probably more of an organisational problem.
Why not ask Erich Gamma about it?

Otherwise it may be an idea to supply a JUnit Update site for eclipse. But I
don't know whether that collides with the installed plugin and how to
resolve such a collision correctly.

Greetings,
Malte
